People in high-income countries emit different amounts of CO2 depending on how rich they are. Going from the poorest 10% to the richest 10%, in 10% increments, which of the options accurately explains the change in emissions?
option_a: The amount of emissions gradually decreases from the poorest 10% to the richest 10%
option_b: The amount evenly increases from the poorest 10% to the richest 10%
option_c: The amount evenly increases from the poorest to the richest, until the richest 10% where it increases rapidly
correct_answer: The amount evenly increases from the poorest to the richest, until the richest 10% where it increases rapidly

question_text: Which answer best describes how the average temperature in the atmosphere has changed over the last 40 years, below and above 12km?
option_a: The temperature in the atmosphere increased, both above and below 12km
option_b: The temperature in the atmosphere decreased above 12km but increased below 12km
option_c: The temperature in the atmosphere increased above 12km but decreased below 12km
correct_answer: The temperature in the atmosphere decreased above 12km but increased below 12km
